Sorry I missed this -

In the description of {{component_instance_name}} in the Swagger definition (YARN-Simplified-V1-API-Layer-For-Services.yaml)Â we have this - "Name of the component instance that this container instance belongs to."

In the comments inÂ Container.java, it says "Name of the component that this container instance belongs to."

Let's change the 2 comments in Container.java to matchÂ that in the yaml file to avoid ambiguity - soÂ we should say "component instance" instead of "component".

This message was automatically generated.

There's an example in this file that uses component_name:
hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-site/src/site/markdown/yarn-service/YarnServiceAPI.md

Could you verify that the UI isn't using the component_name field of the Container record? I did not see a place where it was using this, but it would be good to make sure the UI works properly after this change.

Thanks, [~csingh]. I'll also test out the patch.

[~billie.rinaldi], very good point. The UI2 does not use the API response directly and relies on what we dump into ATS. I checked that the instance name is correctly getting set toÂ COMPONENT_INSTANCE_NAME when it gets pushed to ATS.

[~csingh], it is still a good idea to test this patch in your test cluster andÂ ensure that the "Component Instance Information" page in UI2 shows correct data?

/cc [~sunilg]
